test-case.name: fn-string-1
test-case.description: argument and no context item defined.

test-case.name: fn-string-2
test-case.description: argument set to the empty sequence. Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-string-3
test-case.description: argument set to "." and no context node set.

test-case.name: fn-string-4
test-case.description: string() applied to a date

test-case.name: fn-string-5
test-case.description: string() applied to a time

test-case.description: string() applied to a dateTime

test-case.name: fn-string-7
test-case.description: string() applied to a duration

test-case.name: fn-string-8
test-case.description: string() applied to a QName

test-case.name: fn-string-9
test-case.description: string() with no arguments applied to a double

test-case.name: fn-string-22
test-case.description: Evaluation of string() applied to a node that cannot be atomized because it has element-only content. This succeeds, because although getting the typed value of such a node is an error, the string value is well defined. Note, we assume construction from PSVI, therefore insignificant whitespace is stripped.

test-case.name: fn-string-23
test-case.description: Evaluation of string() applied to a function item

test-case.name: K-StringFunc-1
test-case.description: K-StringFunc-1 `string(1, 2)`.

test-case.name: K-StringFunc-2
test-case.description: K-StringFunc-2 ensures that no arguments isn't flagged as invalid.

test-case.name: K-StringFunc-3
test-case.description: K-StringFunc-3 `string(1) eq "1"`.

test-case.name: K-StringFunc-4
test-case.description: K-StringFunc-4 `string(()) eq ""`.

test-case.description: K-StringFunc-5 xs:string.
